Constructor Detail

WorkerImpl

public WorkerImpl(int nr,
                  int prefetch)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
At construction, a worker instance obtains a reference to the local or remote JobManager, registers itself in the RMI registry running at the master process and passes an RMI stub to itself to the (possibly remote) JobManager.
It is important that the central job manager can actively instruct the workers to die if the puzzle is solved.

Method Detail

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Specified by:
getName in interface Worker

run

public void run()
When a worker runs, it repeatetly gets a pending job from the central job manager's queue and computes it. When the queue is empty and closed, the worker synchronizes with the other threads and processes through the idle() barrier in the job manager and enters a new iteration of the algorithm.
The worker can be stopped and terminated by calling the die() method.

N.B.
This method is invoked automatically from the worker's constructor.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

getNodeCount

public long getNodeCount()
Specified by:
getNodeCount in interface Worker

kill

public void kill()
Tells the worker thread to exit.
The worker may not terminate immediately as it finishes its current job first.

Specified by:
kill in interface Worker
